sentences.sentence: That night I did not see him set out on his way.
He got away from me without making a sound.
When I succeeded in catching up with( 跟上 ) him he was walking along with a quick and resolute( 坚定的 ) step.
He said to me merely:
“Ah! You are there . . .”
And he took me by the hand( 拉着...的手 ).
But he was still worrying.
“It was wrong of you to come. You will suffer. I shall look as if I were dead; and that will not be true . . .”
I said nothing.
“You understand . . . it is too far. I cannot carry this body with me. It is too heavy.”
I said nothing.
“But it will be like an old abandoned( 被抛弃的 ) shell( 躯体 ). There is nothing sad about old shells( 躯体 ) . . .”
I said nothing.
He was a little discouraged( 灰心的 ).
But he made one more effort:

“You know, it will be very nice. I, too, shall look at the stars. All the stars will be wells( 井 ) with a rusty( 生锈的 ) pulley( 滑轮 ). All the stars will pour out( 倒 ) fresh water for me to drink . . .”
I said nothing.
“That will be so amusing( 令人开怀的 )! You will have five hundred million little bells, and I shall have five hundred million springs of fresh water . . .”
And he too said nothing more, because he was crying . . .
“Here it is. Let me go on by myself.”
And he sat down, because he was afraid. Then he said, again:
“You know—my flower . . . I am responsible for her. And she is so weak! She is so naive( 天真的 )! She has four thorns( 刺 ), of no use at all, to protect herself against all the world . . .”
I too sat down, because I was not able to stand up any longer.
“There now—that is all . . .”
He still hesitated( 迟疑 ) a little; then he got up. He took one step.
I could not move.
There was nothing but a flash of yellow close to his ankle( 脚踝 ).
He remained motionless( 静止的 ) for an instant.
He did not cry out.
He fell as gently as a tree falls.
There was not even any sound, because of the sand.
And now six years have already gone by . . .
I have never yet told this story.
The companions who met me on my return were well content to see me alive.
I was sad, but I told them: “I am tired.”
Now my sorrow is comforted a little.
That is to say—not entirely.

But I know that he did go back to his planet, because I did not find his body at daybreak( 黎明 ). It was not such a heavy body . . . and at night I love to listen to the stars. It is like five hundred million little bells . . .
But there is one extraordinary thing . . . when I drew the muzzle( 口套 ) for the little prince, I forgot to add the leather strap( 皮带子 ) to it.
He will never have been able to fasten it on his sheep.
So now I keep wondering: what is happening on his planet?
Perhaps the sheep has eaten the flower . . .
At one time I say to myself: “Surely not! The little prince shuts his flower under her glass globe every night, and he watches over( 照看 ) his sheep very carefully . . .”
Then I am happy.
And there is sweetness in the laughter of all the stars.
But at another time I say to myself: “At some moment or other one is absent-minded, and that is enough!
On some one evening he forgot the glass globe, or the sheep got out, without making any noise, in the night . . .”
And then the little bells are changed to tears . . .
Here, then, is a great mystery.
For you who also love the little prince, and for me, nothing in the universe can be the same if somewhere,
we do not know where, a sheep that we never saw has—yes or no?—eaten a rose . . .
Look up at the sky.
Ask yourselves: is it yes or no? Has the sheep eaten the flower? And you will see how everything changes . . .
And no grown-up( 成年人 ) will ever understand that this is a matter of so much importance!
This is, to me, the loveliest and saddest landscape( 风景 ) in the world.
It is the same as that on the preceding( 前面的 ) page, but I have drawn it again to impress it on your memory.
It is here that the little prince appeared on Earth, and disappeared.
Look at it carefully so that you will be sure to recognize it in case you travel someday to the African desert.
And, if you should come upon this spot, please do not hurry on( 着急 ).
Wait for a time, exactly under the star.
Then, if a little man appears who laughs, who has golden hair, and who refuses to answer questions, you will know who he is.
If this should happen, please comfort me.
Send me word that he has come back.

article_info.previous: 今天小王子来到地球的一年了，他说自己该要回去了。“我”非常难过，不愿他离开。
article_info.share_words: Wait for a time, exactly under the star. Then, if a little man appears who laughs, who has golden hair, and who refuses to answer questions, you will know who he is.

question.cn: 对于小王子的劝说，“我”的回应是什么？
question.en: What was “my” response to the little prince's persuasion?

options.cn: “我”把小王子带回了“我们”相遇的地方。
options.en: “I” brought the little prince back to where "we" met.

analysis: 原文提到：“It was wrong of you to come. You will suffer. I shall look as if I were dead; and that will not be true . . .” I said nothing. “You understand . . . it is too far. I cannot carry this body with me. It is too heavy.” I said nothing. “But it will be like an old abandoned shell. There is nothing sad about old shells . . .” I said nothing. 所以答案为C。

question.en: Why did the little prince fall?

options.cn: 因为他被一条毒蛇咬了。
options.en: Because he was bitten by a poisonous snake.

analysis: 文中提到：There was nothing but a flash of yellow close to his ankle. He remained motionless for an instant. He did not cry out.  He fell as gently as a tree falls. 从此处可以推断，小王子被之前的毒蛇咬了。所以答案为A。

question.cn: 回到同伴身边后，我感受如何？
question.en: How did I feel when I returned to my companions?

analysis: 文中提到：The companions who met me on my return were well content to see me alive. I was sad, but I told them: “I am tired.” Now my sorrow is comforted a little. 因此答案选A。

question.cn: 最初，“我”和小王子是在哪里相遇的？
question.en: Where did "I" meet the little prince at the beginning?

analysis: 原文提到：Remember, I had crashed in the desert a thousand miles from any inhabited region. And yet my little man seemed neither to be straying uncertainly among the sands, nor to be fainting from fatigue, or hunger, or thirst, or fear. 所以答案为C。

question.en: Where did the little prince come from?

options.en: He came from  the asteroid B-612.

analysis: 原文提到：I have serious reason to believe that the planet from which the little prince came is the asteroid known as B-612.所以答案为C。

question.cn: 以下哪种事物可能会给一颗很小的行星带来灾难？
question.en: Which of the following things might bring catastrophe to a small planet?

analysis: 原文提到：And if the planet is too small, and the baobabs are too many, they split it in pieces ……he added, “there is no harm in putting off a piece of work until another day. But when it is a matter of baobabs, that always means a catastrophe. 所以答案为C。

question.cn: 对小王子来说，什么才是重要的？
question.en: What was the matter of consequence according to the little prince?

analysis: 原文提到：“If someone loves a flower, of which just one single blossom grows in all the millions and millions of stars, it is enough to make him happy just to look at the stars. He can say to himself, ‘Somewhere, my flower is there . . .’ But if the sheep eats the flower, in one moment all his stars will be darkened . . . And you think that is not important!” 这里是小王子对“我”的责骂，所以表达的是小王子认为重要的东西。所以答案为B。

question.cn: 为什么小王子要离开他的行星和花儿？
question.en: Why did the little prince leave his planet and flower?

options.cn: 因为他厌倦了呆在他的星球上。
options.en: Because he was tired of staying on his planet.

options.cn: 因为他和他的花儿大吵了一架。
options.en: Because he had seriously argued with his flower.

options.cn: 因为他的行星对他的花儿，他的火山们还有他自己来说太小了。
options.en: Because his planet was too small for his flower, volcanoes and himself.

analysis: 原文提到：Then she forced her cough a little more so that he should suffer from remorse just the same. So the little prince, in spite of all the good will that was inseparable from his love, had soon come to doubt her. He had taken seriously words which were without importance, and it made him very unhappy. 之后小王子便向花儿告别离开了，所以离开的原因就是因为他们之前的争吵，答案为B。

question.cn: 小王子怎么看待成年人？
question.en: What did the little prince think of grown-ups?

options.cn: 他认为成年人都很自负。
他认为成年人都很严肃。
他认为成年人都很奇怪。
options.en: He thought grown-ups were very strange.

analysis: 旅程中，小王子多次感叹道：“The grown-ups are very strange,” the little prince said to himself……所以答案为C。

question.cn: 为什么点街灯的人不断点灯、熄灯？
question.en: Why did the lamplighter keep lighting up and putting out his lamp?

options.cn: 因为他对他的命令很忠诚。
options.en: Because he was loyal to his orders.

analysis: 原文提到：“Good morning. Why have you just put out your lamp?” “Those are the orders,” replied the lamplighter. “Good morning.” “What are the orders?” “The orders are that I put out my lamp. Good evening.” And he lighted his lamp again. “But why have you just lighted it again?” “Those are the orders,” replied the lamplighter. “I do not understand,” said the little prince. “There is nothing to understand,” said the lamplighter. “Orders are orders. Good morning.” 所以答案为A。

question.cn: 地理学家遇到小王子之后，做了什么？
question.en: What did the geographer do after he met the little prince?

options.cn: 他告诉了小王子这颗行星上的山川大海的位置。
options.en: He told the little prince the position of oceans and mountains on this planet.

options.cn: 他告诉了小王子他在这颗行星上探索到的内容。
options.en: He told the little prince what he had explored on this planet.

options.cn: 他要求小王子给他描述小王子的行星。
options.en: He asked the little prince to describe the planet of the little prince.

analysis: 原文提到：“Exactly,” the geographer said. “But I am not an explorer. I haven’t a single explorer on my planet. . . You are an explorer! You shall describe your planet to me!”所以答案为C。

question.cn: 小王子什么时候遇到了狐狸？
question.en: When did the little prince meet the fox?

options.cn: 就在小王子来到地球后。
options.en: Right after he came to the earth.

options.cn: 在小王子在花园见到玫瑰之后。
options.en: After he saw the flowers in the garden.

options.cn: 在小王子在沙漠中遇到蛇之前。
options.en: Before he met the snake in the desert.

analysis: 原文提到：Then he went on with his reflections: “I thought that I was rich, with a flower that was unique in all the world; and all I had was a common rose.A common rose, and three volcanoes that come up to my knees—and one of them perhaps extinct forever . . . that doesn’t make me a very great prince . . .” And he lay down in the grass and cried. It was then that the fox appeared. 所以答案为B。

share_title: 100天读完4本英文书，今天是第15天
